## GAD-7 vs BES

GAD-7 vs BES: A Harmonious Comparison Using AI Technology The realm of psychology research often requires intricate and tedious processes, particularly when comparing and harmonising different instruments like the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the Body Esteem Scale (BES). Doing this task manually can lead to inconsistencies and subjective results. However, transitioning to automated comparison by using the Harmony software offers faster and consistent comparisons. A vital function of Harmony in the GAD-7 vs BES comparison is its ability to measure the percentage match between each item in these two instruments. This AI-powered tool uses a large language model to present accurate and efficient comparisons, thus transforming the historically time-consuming effort into a streamlined process. It can handle multiple languages, making it an invaluable tool regardless of the setting or participant demographic. To leverage this crucial tool in comparing GAD-7 and BES, simply select the instruments from Harmony's database or drag and drop your own versions of these instruments into Harmony's web interface. No longer will you spend countless hours on manual comparison and harmonisation. With the advanced AI technology of Harmony, the GAD-7 vs BES comparison is brought into a new dimension of speed, accuracy, and efficiency.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and BES

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and BES into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just BES into Harmony</a> - compare BES with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
